text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Sequence IDomainResourceSequence of a macromolecule
Start and end position should be non-negative, and end position must be larger than start position.
CIGAR string should conform with extended-cigar's syntax.
chromosome 1..1stringChromosome of the sequence
startPosition 1..1integerStart position of the sequence
endPosition 1..1integerEnd position of the sequence
direction 0..1codeforward | reverse
StrandDirection (Required)
cigar 0..1stringCIGAR string for the sequence
sample 0..1codegermline | somatic | prenatal
SampleType (Required)
lab 0..1ProcedureLab where the sequence is determined
patient 1..1PatientWhom the sequence is determined for
species 1..1CodeableConceptSpecies of the organism whom the sequence belongs to
SNOMED CT Codes for species (Required)
quantity 0..1QuantityQuantity of molecule encoded by the sequence presenting in the sample
genomeBuild 0..1stringGenome assembly
type 1..1codedna | rna | aa
SequenceType (Required)
referenceBases 0..1stringReference bases of the sequence
observedBases 1..1stringObserved bases of the sequence
name 0..*stringName of the sequence. i.e. Rs6313

element.definition: This resource records information about sequence of a moleculde. E.g. a DNA sequence.

constraint.human: Start and end position should be non-negative, and end position must be larger than start position.
constraint.xpath: boolean(f:start/@value >= 0) and boolean(f:start/@value >=0) and boolean(f:end/@value > f:start/@value)

constraint.human: CIGAR string should conform with extended-cigar's syntax.

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the url for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
The base language in which the resource is written.

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
Chromosome of the sequence. E.g. "1" for chromosome 1. Note that value of `chromosome` is not limited to a human's chromosomes, as the sequence can be from other species such as Tuberculosis.
0-based location start position of the sequence.
0-based end location (exclusive) of the sequence.
Direction of the strand.  Forward means the sequence is in 5'-3' direction, reverse otherwise.

Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases. See detailed documentation [here](http://support.illumina.com/help/SequencingAnalysisWorkflow/Content/Vault/Informatics/Sequencing_Analysis/CASAVA/swSEQ_mCA_ExtendedCIGARFormat.htm).
Tissue sample from which molecules encoded by the sequence are extracted.

binding.description: Type of the sample used to determine a seauence

element.short: Lab where the sequence is determined
element.definition: Lab where the sequence is determined.

element.short: Whom the sequence is determined for
element.definition: Whom the sequence is determined for. In a prenatal sequencing test, the patient being referenced is the birthgiver.

element.short: Species of the organism whom the sequence belongs to
element.definition: Species of the organism whom the sequence belongs to. The species is not limited to Homo sapiens. E.g. the sequence can be a DNA sequence of a bacteria.

binding.description: Species of the organism to whom the sequence belongs to

element.short: Quantity of molecule encoded by the sequence presenting in the sample
element.definition: Quantity of molecule encoded by the sequence presenting in the sample.
Genome assembly used to align the sequence.
Type of the sequence. E.g. DNA.
Reference bases of the sequence.
Observed bases of the sequence.

element.short: Name of the sequence. i.e.  Rs6313
element.definition: Human readable name of the sequence -- i.e. rs6313. This field makes the sequence searchable by text.
This resource records information about sequence of a moleculde. E.g. a DNA sequence.

constraint.human: Start and end position should be non-negative, and end position must be larger than start position.
constraint.xpath: boolean(f:start/@value >= 0) and boolean(f:start/@value >=0) and boolean(f:end/@value > f:start/@value)

constraint.human: CIGAR string should conform with extended-cigar's syntax.

0-based location start position of the sequence.
0-based end location (exclusive) of the sequence.
Direction of the strand.  Forward means the sequence is in 5'-3' direction, reverse otherwise.

Extended CIGAR string for aligning the sequence with reference bases. See detailed documentation [here](http://support.illumina.com/help/SequencingAnalysisWorkflow/Content/Vault/Informatics/Sequencing_Analysis/CASAVA/swSEQ_mCA_ExtendedCIGARFormat.htm).
Tissue sample from which molecules encoded by the sequence are extracted.

element.definition: Lab where the sequence is determined.

element.definition: Whom the sequence is determined for. In a prenatal sequencing test, the patient being referenced is the birthgiver.

element.short: Species of the organism whom the sequence belongs to
element.definition: Species of the organism whom the sequence belongs to. The species is not limited to Homo sapiens. E.g. the sequence can be a DNA sequence of a bacteria.
